text: Denis Sayers (born 17 March 1934) was an English cricketer. He was a right- handed batsman and a right-arm medium-pace bowler. He was born in St. Pancras, London. Having represented the Second XI as far back as 1963, Sayers made a single first-class appearance for Essex, during the 1967 season. Sayers finished not out in the first innings, and did not bat in the second, bowling during both Nottinghamshire innings. Sayers was a tailend batsman for the Second XI, who held this position during his one first-class match. ==External links== *Denis Sayers at Cricket Archive Category:1934 births Category:Living people Category:English cricketers Category:Essex cricketers Category:People from St Pancras, London
title: Denis Sayers
